intro: Stylidium ricae, commonly known as the red-stemmed triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique trigger mechanism that releases pollen. The plant features bright red stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically orange or red in color. Stylidium ricae is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils.
